description.narrative:
Australia and New Zealand are assisting Tonga to construct a parliament building (Fale Alea) and the office of legislative assembly (OLA) to replace those destroyed or damaged by Cyclone Gita in February 2018. MFAT as Lead Donor will manage the procurement and contracts, and DFAT as the Co-Donor will provide funding support under a Delegated Cooperation Arrangement. The goal for the TPBP is to strengthen parliamentary democracy and good governance in Tonga, by providing a recognisable symbol in the form of a purpose-built Fale Alea, and a modern fit-for-purpose OLA to provide ongoing and improved access for the people of Tonga to parliamentary process.
The TPBP objective is to develop an architecturally significant Fale Alea and an OLA that are climate resilient, cost-effective, fit-for-purpose and appropriately fitted-out to meet the 21st century needs of Tonga’s parliamentary processes.
